decision_conditions:
The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

The development hereby granted must be completed within a period of 3 years starting with the date this prior approval is granted.REASON: In accordance with Condition AC.2 (3) of Class AC of Part 20 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The proposed erection of one additional storey to provide 1 new residential unit is in accordance with the limitations set out in AC.1 and AC.2 of Class AC of Part 20 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended) and therefore the application is therefore granted conditional approval.

Following the development, every dwellinghouse in the building must remain in use as a dwellinghouse within the meaning of Class C3 of the Schedule to the Use Classes Order and for  no other purpose, except to the extent that the other purpose is ancillary to the primary use as a  dwellinghouse.REASON: To protect neighbouring amenity and in accordance with condition AC.2 (7) Class AC of Part 20 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The developer must notify the local planning authority of the completion of the development as soon as reasonably practicable after completion. The notification must be in writing and must includeâ€”(i) the name of the developer;(ii) the address or location of the development; and(iii) the date of completion.REASON: In accordance with conditions AC.2 (5) and (6) Class AC of Part 20 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Prior to commencement, the developer must provide the local planning authority with a report for the management of the construction of the development, which sets out the proposed development hours of operation and how any adverse impact of noise, dust, vibration and traffic on occupiers of the building and adjoining owners or occupiers will be mitigated.REASON: To ensure effects are adequately managed to protect neighbouring amenity in accordance with condition AC.2 (4) of Class AC of Part 20 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
description: Prior approval for the erection of one additional storey to the existing dwellinghouse to provide one self-contained residential unit (Use Class C3) under Class AC Schedule 2, Part 20 of the The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted  Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).
